intro: Erodium chium proles cuneatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its slender, cuneate (wedge-shaped) leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is found in various regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It has a low-growing habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. The species is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
